question: You ok?
answer: What's been holding me together is the hope that maybe you do go someplace. And I'll be seeing her again soon. Only what will I say? That I was too stupid to find the guy who killed her? That he's down here laughing?

question: Tell her... we'll get him.
answer: We won't.

question: No. It's time.
answer: I don't want you to watch. I don't want to give them the pleasure.

question: Ok. C'mon now...
answer: I loved Lauren. I still do. I'm innocent. Murderer!

question: Get me some backup. We got one loose on the row. Now who the fuck are you? And what have you done to your face there beauty queen?
answer: It's my birthday.

question: Yeah, well... here's a present for you. It's ok. Man. Had me going there.
answer: Go ahead. Make a wish.

question: Taser!
answer: Keys? I hear the pitter patter of little feet. Damn.

question: Then who was the fucking Houdini?
answer: Happy birthday. Police? Evidence? Look. I like what we've got going here. But I can think of lots better to do with it than fighting crime. Know what I mean? Ok, ok... what? Nothing under "Crow." Execution? Lauren... What are you, an Angel?

question: I thought I'd be with you now.
answer: Your Shaolin style is no match for my kung fu.

question: I'm not dead. And I'm not alive. And I'm remembering. And it hurts.
answer: Your... flying crane style is no match for my... drunken tiger kick.

question: I can't be alive. Not without you.
answer: Your... mad monkey... love ... is no match for...

question: I want to be with you forever.
answer: Only forever?

question: Dad... I want to take this to Lauren. She'd want it.
answer: Honey. I just can't.

question: Stay in the car. I'll only take a second.
answer: Erin. I know you think she's been talking to you.

question: It's not that. Really. It's just... now that he's gone, I think it's time.
answer: It's ok. I'm not going to hurt you.

question: Don't come near me!
answer: I was a friend of your sister's.

question: I know her friends.
answer: That locket you're holding. You have one just like it.

question: Yeah, no kidding.
answer: Your father gave them to both of you.

question: And he's right over there by the way. What did you do to your face?
answer: Someone else did it.

question: You're a friend of the guy who killed her, aren't you? You almost sound like him.
answer: He didn't kill her.

question: How do you know?
answer: I know everything about your sister. I'll prove it to you.

question: Stay away from me! Dad! Dad!
answer: Erin!

question: Watch out!
answer: What were you yelling about?

question: This guy said he was a friend of Lauren's. He had like paint all over his face.
answer: Are you ok?

question: March?!
answer: Sssshhh. She's resting.

question: Where the fuck did you come from?
answer: Big bang, primordial ooze, divine hand of a benevolent creator? All possibilities. Although recent events have given me doubts about the benevolent creator. You lied at my trial.

question: I don't know you, man.
answer: Capital case nine nine dash C one one five. Alex Corvis. Exhibit A.

question: Hey. I said what I saw. Two kids arguing. A guy and a girl.
answer: You said you saw me with this. I never held it until today.

question: What's your damage, man? Corvis hacked up that girl like a motherfucker.
answer: One chance to tell the truth, Tommy. Who is the man with the scar? He planted this in my car.

question: There's no scar. Corvis made it up.
answer: Wrong. Answer.

question: Your baby is crying. Go. What did they give you?
answer: They showed me pictures, what he did to her. Evidence. Said all I had to do was stand up there and not my head "yes."

question: What did they give you?
answer: A job. Construction. Twelve an hour.

question: Write down their names. All of them.
answer: You already got 'em. Right here. These cops said the needed an eyewitness, or Corvis would walk.

question: Oh no... Anything wrong?
answer: Let's hope not. License and registration please. What's with your friend there?

question: She's... sick. Actually she never had Mai Tais before.
answer: But you, you've had them.

question: Not tonight. Honest.
answer: If you had a license, I bet I'd have seen it by now. How old are you? Fifteen?

question: Look, I'll tell you the truth. Jannie drove us and was supposed to drive us back, she has a license, but I mean... look at her. Get up, get up...!
answer: Why don't you get out.

question: You want me to walk a straight line?
answer: I want you... to bend over.

question: Look, can I just call a cab?
answer: What did I say? Maybe I'll ask your friend.

question: What did I say? Maybe I'll ask your friend.
answer: I want you... to bend over. Officer Dutton.

question: Where'd you come from? Out of the car. Now! Hands on the car.
answer: Question. These hands?

question: You're up. Ladies. Drive carefully. You might want to call 911. Report an officer down.
answer: That was a fucking hollow point!

question: I guess it's true. Guns don't kill people... Think maybe knives do?
answer: Keep that thing away from me.

question: This is not just some "thing." It's A C zero zero five.
answer: You're the skel broke into the evidence room. Fuck! What do you want?

question: A scar. On the arm. Of the man who planted this in Alex Corvis's car.
answer: There's no scar, you freak. The Corvis kid made it up.

question: He was innocent. You framed him. You. And Erlich. And Larkin. And Toomey. What do you think, Officer Dutton? An eye for an eye? You were there. All four of you. You killed her. I saw it.
answer: Bitch killed herself when she shot a cop in the leg. If she' just acted like a girl nothing would have happened. So you're right, spooky. Happy?

question: Police!
answer: You fuck. Don't do that.

question: How's the month end?
answer: Oh yes. Never been better.

question: Where's Dutton?
answer: Probably parked near some high school with a hardon. Fuck never showed.

question: Anyone at all curious why? You leave the door open with two hundred strangers out there! What's it take for you guys to learn a goddamn lesson?
answer: No one saw anything, Mad.

question: You know why Dutton's not here? Rigor mortis! He's dead. One shot to the head, then fifty three stab wounds with a six inch blade. Any deja vu here? Think Corvus knife, missing from the evidence room.
answer: Since when?

question: What? What is it?
answer: Lauren called me that when we were little. Daisy. No one knew but us.

question: Honey. It's doesn't mean anything. It's not a message.
answer: That guy in the cemetery today said he knew everything about Lauren.

question: It still doesn't mean...
answer: He said he'd prove it.

question: Maybe if you hadn't fried an innocent kid...
answer: Who is it?

question: How about the real killer. You think of that?
answer: If you're covering for someone, that's jail time. I got my eye on you.

question: Alex?
answer: No, no... No! Shit!

question: No, no... No! Shit!
answer: The Germans really know how to make a car, don't they? I heard you were looking for this.

question: You're the guy killed Dutton.
answer: I want you to think of me as the guy who killed you.

question: Stop the car.
answer: Ow.

question: Fuck. Me.
answer: What happened to your leg there Officer? Hunting accident? Lauren Randall shot you trying to get free. The fifty three stab wounds she died of came from you. Am I right? Ballpark? In Saudi Arabia they cut off the hands of petty thieves. What price for a life? Two lives?

question: Not my arm! What you fucking want?
answer: I want Lauren. I want my life back. I want... to know why.

question: Why? Why's anything happen? It's all money, man. Money. The girl just got in the way.
answer: The scar. Which of you has it?

question: Nobody. I swear. It's a bullshit fucking story the loser boyfriend made up. Are you out of your fucking mind? We're going to die.
answer: How can you die if you're already dead?

question: You're him. Corvis.
answer: I was talking about you.

question: I was talking about you.
answer: Daisy. How did you know?

question: I told you, I knew your sister.
answer: You killed that cop Dutton.

question: And another one. There. Erlich. Took a wrong turn.
answer: I know who you are. That's why you paint your face. To hide.

question: I'm not hiding. I'm right here.
answer: You killed Lauren! You killed her!

question: Not me. Dirty cops killed her. Dutton, Erlich... I've been shot, and stabbed and thrown from a car and none of it hurt. But what you're doing now, does. I don't know why.
answer: My dad was right! He said you'd ruin her life.

question: No. Listen to me. Lauren found out something they didn't want her to know. This. From the bonfire over there. Look at it.
answer: No! Why are you haunting me?

question: Right back at ya.
answer: Sit down. I thought we had an understanding. I thought we understood that discretion is paramount.

question: Yeah, we do.
answer: Shut up. Erlich gimping around in his goddamn hot rod is not discreet. I've got reporters asking me how much he made. I've got the entire force looking at this case now.

question: I know.
answer: You know.

question: I know the guy leaves a sign.
answer: No shit he leaves a sign. He's a goddamn Picasso. What else do you know? Do you know this?

question: Tommy Leonard. The eyewitness in the Corvis case.
answer: Some hooker phoned it in. There was a riot at his apartment yesterday.

question: Guy dressed for Halloween?
answer: Good for you. You do know something. Don't say. Just do. Before it all comes tumbling down. Idiots.

question: What are you doing there?
answer: I think I dropped an earring.

question: Looks like you have them both on.
answer: Alex Corvis didn't kill Lauren. Cops did. Didn't they? You're in with them.

question: It's not what you think.
answer: You killed her!

question: No.
answer: Stay away from me! Stay away!

question: Erin. It wasn't supposed to happen. They killed her because she found out.
answer: About you.

question: About them. You've got to leave it alone. Sweetheart...
answer: Don't call me that! Don't call me anything!

question: I would never hurt you or Lauren. Never. Believe me.
answer: I don't believe you.

question: Please. Come inside.
answer: I'm never going back in that house again. Get away. They killed Alex for something you did, daddy. You killed both of them.

question: I'm not making this up. He had a crow with him.
answer: Caw, caw, that's what you're telling me.

question: He said I lied at his trial. It's Alex Corvis.
answer: So we're talking... a ghost. With a pet bird. Turn down that fucking baby! Get up, Tommy. I want to show you something. You see that? My name's next on his list. It's fucking next. So who is the guy, Tommy?

question: Corvis. It's...
answer: Take your time. Think before you speak. Cause at this point I got to hear something besides the crap you're been spewing.

question: Alex? C'mon. I'm talking to my myself here. It's humiliating. Check and mate.
answer: Dream on.

question: My God. It's really you under there. I'd like to say you're looking good, but...
answer: Two down. Two to go.

question: "Down?" Wait, don't tell me.
answer: The cops from my trial. They killed Lauren. The whole thing was fixed. You think I'm crazy.

question: I'm thinking... that explains a lot.
answer: Lauren's father's involved. He bought the cops fancy cars, I don't know what else. It's a company called D-E-L-T. I think Lauren found out.

question: What do they do that they had to kill her?
answer: I was hoping you'd find out.

question: Yeah. I sure will. Boo! What's the deal with this bird. It's been hanging around. Alex?
answer: This is where it happened. Right over here.

question: This is where it happened. Right over here.
answer: Yeah, I know.

question: Are you ok?
answer: When Lauren was missing the police came to our house. They said they were looking for her, right? But I know now they had her, and the reason they brought her here and knew the could blame it on you...

question: No...
answer: ... is that I sent them here. I told them she came here sometimes. With her dirtball boyfriend. That's exactly what I said.

question: Erin. It's not your fault.
answer: It's all my fault. Oh God. I wish I were dead.

question: No. You don't.
answer: Yes I do, I really do.

question: There were four of them.
answer: No...

question: Why wasn't the incident reported?
answer: Nothing to report. All inmates were present and accounted for.

question: So you pretended nothing happened.
answer: Hey, Corvis fried. I don't really see how it could be him.

question: No. I wouldn't expect you to.
answer: Be forewarned. Nature takes its toll. Bon appetit.

question: ... with the scar... ... took everything I ever cared about. Left me with nothing.
answer: So you're going to kill him?

question: Have to find him first. You know what Lauren and I were fighting about that night? She had a secret, wouldn't tell me...
answer: My father.

question: All I knew, she was pulling away. It made me crazy.
answer: I used to be so proud of him. My big deal daddy. And now, he's just a crook. Worse even. And the weird thing is... I wish I could hate him but I can't. He said he'd never hurt either of us, and I know it's true and... I'm going back.

question: It's what Lauren would do.
answer: I want to forget. Forget what I know. Forget myself. Forget everything. Keep it. Because it connects you to Lauren. And it connects you to me. No matter what happens I'll make sure everyone knows. That you're innocent. That you loved her. I promise. I don't want to be me anymore. Make me like you.

question: You know it doesn't work this way. Partnerships don't end like that. Friendships don't. Do you believe in ghosts, Nathan? Because there's a ghost threatening us.
answer: You mean Alex.

question: I mean Lauren. Because you never accepted that what happened to her was an accident.
answer: You killed my daughter.

question: An accident, Nathan.
answer: She was eighteen years old! There were four of them. They stabbed her fifty three times! Where's the fucking accident?! Huh?! Where is it?!

question: I watched her grow up. Just like you. I know how her mind worked. She kept snooping around because she was worried about you. What you'd gotten yourself into. So stop blaming me. And blame yourself.
answer: I do. Every day.

question: It's like a bowl of spaghetti. D-E- L-T is owned by Westwind Builders, Nathan Randall's company. But DELT in turn owns a dozen other corporations. A big mess to wade through, so I checked out Tommy Leonard.
answer: Leonard, Dutton, Erlich. They don't matter. I want the King.

question: We're getting there. Because in his so-called construction job, Tommy makes a daily delivery to a place called "The Hole."
answer: The strip joint?

question: Alex! They killed my dad.
answer: It's ok, it's ok...

question: It's not. I can't take it.
answer: Erin. Who?

question: I don't know. I found him lying there.
answer: Where is it? This place?

question: You followed me here.
answer: No... Erin, I put out a bulletin on your car because... there's bad news. And I thought you should hear it from me. Your father got involved with some bad cops. On my force, so I take responsibility. He killed himself.

question: How?
answer: How did he kill himself? With a gun. Is that what you mean?

question: Cheers. Toomey! You dripped something! Spark, gas... bad combination. And it's not this leak here, that's the least of your worries. We're going to play a little game called "Who's got the Scar."
answer: What Scar? What fucking scar?

question: AAAANK. That's not how we play the game.
answer: You're him! You're Corvis! We fried your ass. You're dead, man!

question: Good thing in a situation like this.
answer: Fucking Zombie.

question: The scar.
answer: There is no scar. I'm telling you.

question: Erin! The King.
answer: I hate that picture.

question: Where are they?
answer: Can I get you something? A glass of water? A transfusion?

question: Where are they? Last chance.
answer: Or what? You'll bleed all over my carpet? You know crime was actually down until you showed up, or stuck around, or whatever the hell you're doing here. What are you doing here?

question: I'm looking for my friends.
answer: See, I heard you were looking for some guy with a scar. How's that going? You find him? Yes? No? You are like the guest who would not leave, you know that? And judging from your condition, maybe you've overstayed your welcome. That's not a criticism. Just an observation. I don't think you're going to use it. That's Lauren's knife. You come in here al lfull of righteous indignation, but what have you got to be righteous about? How many innocent people did you leave dead back there?

question: You sent them. I had no choice.
answer: Bullshit. You're a killer, that's all you are. A clown with a bird and a rising death toll. You think the world did you wrong?! You did the world wrong. You and Lauren had a fight. You couldn't let it go.

question: You see it? Huh? Did you see it? Yeah. I think you fucking saw it.
answer: You were right. Picture's worth a thousand words.

question: Just don't believe everything you see.
answer: Doubt is a motherfucker.
